Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: The latest update broke my activity zone notifications. I tried removing and reinstalling all my cameras and it's still messed up. Customer service was no help resolving the issue. I hope a future update fixes it. Edit #1: I finally discovered (on my own) what the issue is. Unless you have "person seen" activated, you will not get notifications in an activity zone when someone walks by. With this option turned off, you will only get notifications for motion. For example: a bird flying by or waving your hand directly in front of the camera. This is extremely unfortunate for people who only want person seen notifications in specific activity zone instead of in the entire camera's field of vision. For example: a camera pointing outside where people regularly walk by, but you are only interested in notifications in a specific zone. The only other option is to turn on "person seen" and get a million notifications throughout the day and hope that one of them is within the activity zone you actually care about. I really hope they fix this so "person seen" is a unique option for each activity zone instead of the camera overall. Currently, it's a broken feature. Edit #2: still no good feedback from Nest on how to solve the notification issues. I've had to "hack" my cameras by smudging/dirtying the lens making the video quality blurry. This tricks the camera into not recognizing if a person walks in an activity zone. Instead, it only sees it as motion which results in the notifications I want. Pretty sad that I have to do this in order to get a simple feature to work. Edit #3: I unsubscribed from Nest Aware since there is still an issue with motion alerts and person alerts. No point in throwing away money.

If you don't, the sensors always 'sense' activity and keep them in home mode. I have no pets or any other factors that cause movement when we aren't home. Text: The Logi Circle is better! I bought both at the same time but expected the Nest Cam to be superior because of its higher cost. I've found the Nest Cam to be inferior in several different aspects but I'll focus the app here. The Nest app is terribly unintuitive and badly designed for a company owned by alphabet/google. Problem 1: I can't scrub through the sightline to a specific time. The app will mislead you into thinking that you can since you can drag the blue marker line to a specific time, but once you let go, the video will skip forward or backward to the beginning or end of whatever Nest decides is the activity event. This means I'll waste a bunch of time trying to get closer and closer to a certain event before realizing the app won't let me go to a specific time. Then I'll give up and waste my life starting from the beginning of whatever they decide is the start of the activity. For example, I might know that a specific event happened right around 10:32:50, but I'll only be able to start watching from 10:30:00 because Nest might decide that that was the start of the activity. I can't skip right to the action. Problem 1.5: After wasting a bunch of time watching activity I'm not interested to get to the meat, I accidentally discovered you can speed up this process by touching the video. When you touch the screen, little button overlays will show up that will allow you to go backwards or forwards 15 seconds. It's still imprecise and you still waste time having to watch activity you're no interested in of you have a specific time in mind. This is also unintuitive. Why would I randomly decide to touch the above video playback while I'm trying to use the sightline below to scrub through the recordings? Terrible design. Problem 2: If I decide to save a clip, I don't know what I'm getting until I press the save/share button (the icon is also badly designed... it should be a simple downward download arrow, not a freaking right facing arrow). Once I click that button, I'll get a pop up message saying that the clip was added to my nest aware account. Then the next screen shows the clip that was added which is ridiculous because they only show you the clip after you click the save/sharw button. The clip might be 15s long or 1min long. The clip may contain the activity you wanted, or it may not. I don't know how they decide what should be clipped but it's terribly unintuitive and a huge waste of time. For example, if an activity of interest happens around 10:32:50, I might want to save a clip from 10:32:45 to 10:33:30. But I don't get to select the beginning or the end. I don't even get an option to specify that at least a certain time should be included in whatever interval they decide is best. And there's no way for me to pause at 10:32:50 and tap the save button. So I end up tapping the save button while the recording is playing and hope that the part I'm watching gets included in the clip they decide to save. It's not garanteed that the part you're interested will be included since they don't let you specify what you're interested in. Problem 2.5: Further, on this next screen after you click the save button and the message pops up saying the clip was added to your account, there is a "cancel" button option. Cancel what?! I thought the clip was already added to my account. If there is a cancel option, then were is the confirm/continue option? If I press cancel, then does the clip get removed from my account? What happens if I go back on my phone without tapping any of their button? It's unclear. Problem 3: So you get this message saying that this clip was added to your account, but there is no way for you to actually access your clips on your account on the app. ??? (I think you have to use a computer.) Problem 4: After you have wasted your life trying to get close to a specific time, you might decide to change your phone orientation. Big mistake! Instead of continuing, the marker skips back to the beginning of the activity clip and you have to waste your life again trying to find the activity at the specific time.

I then checked phone (S7 Edge if it matters any to this issue), and I was away. Which then quickly changed to HOME and started to heat. As soon as I got out of the app and put my phone down, ok walked by and I was on EVO again. Checked phone again, and I was away, then it went back to HOME and started to heat. (PS... I only use the phones location to detect if home since the home sensors keep picking up my cats and think we are home when at work.) I looked up reviews and saw something about GOOGLE Assistant being on Nougat, So I checked this by pressing and holding the home button on phone and Assistant opened. I followed the tutorial and clicked the 3 dots top right corner, then settings, HOME CONTROL,add device, and there was the NEST. Clicked that and had to sign into NEST account. Now they are linked. Since I did that... my thermostat is working again and has not switched to ECO while home! If this happens again, I will update and contact NEST but I wonder if with the new update to NOUGAT things are thrown off. Even other apps I use don't remember my phone and have to start fresh each login. Hope this helps at all.

Text: I've just completed the replacement of the original electronic time clock of our home heating system with the Nest Thermostat and Nest Protect. It is all working correctly, and apart from now setting up the schedule times for heating and hot water, we are absolutely delighted with the products. My only negative comment is regarding the time settings for heat or water. These are in 30 minute increments. It should be possible with future software updates to change time settings by 5 minute increments, giving the user more precise control over scheduling. Having considered other manufacturers' similar type products, I think this is the best on the market. I have no hesitation in recommending Nest.
